law.catch_line: A claim for damage to property resulting from a motor vehicle accident may not be denied or payment ...

text.section: A claim for damage to property resulting from a motor vehicle accident may not be denied or payment of the claim delayed because the claimant, or another person, has a claim pending for bodily injury that may have arisen from the same or another accident.

The amount payable for a claim for damage to property is due and owing immediately and shall be paid promptly by an insurer or by a self-insurer that is approved under § 17-103(a) of the Transportation Article if:
the insurer or self-insurer has provided the coverage for the liable party; and
there is no significant dispute about:
the liability for the payment of the full property damages; or
the monetary amount of those damages, including:
if claimed, an amount for the loss of the use of the motor vehicle; and
the cost of obtaining an estimate of repairs.
